title: AFL trades live: Updates, moves, rumours, news
text:
All eyes will be on Essendon as the Bombers enter the AFL Trade Period as one of its prime movers and shakers.

With Joe Daniher officially requesting a trade to Sydney, and Orazio Fantasia tipped to seek a move to Port Adelaide, the Bombers look set to be one of the most influential players on the market.

It now lies with Sydney to orchestrate a deal that satisfies the Bombers, who have made it clear they want to keep Daniher as he is contracted until the end of 2020.

Former Bombers player Brendon Goddard however hit out at Joe and put the onus of his injury concerns back on him.

“In this case it does feel like he owes the club,” Goddard told RSN.

“As much as the injuries affected him, he could’ve gone about it in a better way with his rehab, particularly the first time around.

“At the time I didn’t think he dedicated himself hard enough to recovering and rehab and giving himself the best chance to get up and play and get himself right.

“That’s why it’s a bit disappointing.”

"Disappointed to be honest. Sadly this may lead to Orazio and making his decision a little easier. I think he could have gone about it a better way with his rehab."



Brendon Goddard says Joe Daniher didn't dedicate himself to his rehabilitation enough #RSNBreakfastClub — RSN Breakfast Club (@RSNBreakfast) October 6, 2019 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

Club great and Joe's uncle Terry opened up on his nephew's request to move away from the club where the Daniher's made a name in the league.

"Essendon are a great club and I think that he (Joe) must have his reasons for wanting to go," Daniher said on SEN Breakfast.

"It’s pretty disappointing to see that when you're trying to build a team.

"We’re just like Melbourne and other clubs trying to edge our way north to challenge the clubs like Richmond and Geelong to get right up there.

"To have someone like Joey and Fantasia putting their hand up for trade, it makes you scratch your head a bit.

"You don’t want to lose any of your good players."

"As I sit here this morning, I feel that there's a big chance that Essendon could say to Daniher to come back and play for 12 more months"



– Matthew Lloyd#AFLtrade — Telstra AFL Trade Radio (@traderadio) October 6, 2019 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

Former Bombers star Matthew Lloyd believes the club could fall into a similar position as Geelong did last year.

"I wonder if we do get to a position like Tim Kelly last year, where the Bombers say to Daniher he needs to play for another year and then re-visit it, unless the Swans are willing to deal one of their key players," Lloyd said on AFL Trade Radio.

"He's a good player, but I think if it's presented to Essendon first up I don't think that it will be accepted"



– Matthew Lloyd on whether Tom McCartin and a pick could be involved with the Daniher trade#AFLTrade — Telstra AFL Trade Radio (@traderadio) October 6, 2019 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

The trade period opens at 9am AEDT Monday, October 6 and closes at 7.30pm AEDT on Wednesday, October 16.
